Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different plants and animals, including humans.
The student can draw and label the places where different plants and animals live.
The student can show what each plant and animal needs to survive, like water, air, or sunlight, in their drawing.
The student can illustrate how the living things and their habitats work together as a system.
The student can represent the connections between animals or plants and the resources they use in their drawings.
The student can demonstrate patterns, such as plants needing sunlight and growing in sunny areas, through the illustration.
